Cranberry and Brie Bites

Jump to Recipe

Cranberry and Brie Bites are a delightful fusion of sweet and savory flavors, perfect for any occasion, whether it’s a holiday gathering, a cocktail party, or a simple family dinner. This easy-to-follow recipe combines the creamy richness of Brie cheese with the tartness of cranberry sauce, all wrapped in flaky puff pastry for a bite-sized treat that is sure to impress your guests. With just a few basic ingredients, including puff pastry, Brie, and cranberry sauce, you can create mouthwatering appetizers that not only look stunning but also taste incredible. Prepping these bites is quick and effortless, making them an ideal choice for both seasoned chefs and kitchen novices alike. Join me as we dive into this scrumptious recipe that will elevate your entertaining game and leave everyone asking for seconds!

Ingredients

puff pastry sheets

Ensure the puff pastry is thawed properly before rolling it out; this prevents tearing. You can substitute with phyllo dough for a flakier texture, but be sure to layer it with melted butter for moisture. If you're looking for a gluten-free option, consider using gluten-free puff pastry.

brie cheese

Choose a high-quality Brie for the best flavor; it should be soft and creamy. If unavailable, Camembert is a great substitute, offering a similar taste and texture. For a twist, try adding a slice of apple or pear alongside the Brie for added sweetness and crunch.

cranberry sauce

Use homemade cranberry sauce for a fresher taste, or opt for a store-bought version if you're short on time. If you want to enhance the flavor, consider adding a pinch of cinnamon or orange zest to the sauce before use. For a different flavor profile, you can substitute with cherry preserves or fig jam.

egg (for egg wash)

Beaten egg gives a beautiful golden color; however, you can use milk or cream as an egg wash alternative for a similar effect. If you want to add flavor, mix in a pinch of salt or herbs into the egg wash before applying.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Oven

    Begin by preheating your oven to 400°F (200°C). This ensures the puff pastry cooks evenly and becomes golden brown.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Puff Pastry

    Roll out the puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface. Cut it into 12 equal squares, approximately 3x3 inches each. If you're new to working with puff pastry, keep it cool until you're ready to use it to prevent it from becoming too sticky.

  • Step 3: Form the Pastry Cups

    Place each square of pastry into a mini muffin tin, pressing gently to form a cup shape. This will hold the filling. If you don’t have a mini muffin tin, you can use a regular muffin tin, but baking time may vary.

  • Step 4: Add the Brie Cheese

    Cut the Brie cheese into small pieces, about 1 inch in size, and place one piece in each pastry cup. Brie melts beautifully, so make sure each cup gets a generous portion for that gooey goodness.

  • Step 5: Top with Cranberry Sauce

    Spoon a small amount (about a teaspoon) of cranberry sauce on top of each piece of Brie in the pastry cups. The tartness of the cranberry will complement the creamy Brie perfectly.

  • Step 6: Prepare the Egg Wash

    Beat the egg in a small bowl to create an egg wash. Using a pastry brush, gently brush the edges of the pastry with the egg wash. This will give your bites a lovely golden finish after baking.

  • Step 7: Bake

    Place the muffin tin in the preheated oven and bake for 12-15 minutes. Keep an eye on them; you want the pastry to be golden brown and the cheese to be melted. If they’re browning too quickly, you can cover them loosely with aluminum foil.

  • Step 8: Cool and Serve

    Once baked, remove the cranberry and Brie bites from the oven and allow them to cool slightly before serving. They will be hot and the cheese will be very melty, so give them a few minutes to set.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare puff pastry before cooking?

Start by thawing the puff pastry in the fridge for a few hours or at room temperature for about 30 minutes. Once it’s pliable, roll it out on a lightly floured surface to avoid sticking.

What is the best way to cut puff pastry?

Use a sharp knife or pizza cutter to cut the puff pastry. This helps prevent the edges from sealing together, allowing it to rise properly during baking.

How do I know when the puff pastry is done baking?

The pastry is done when it turns golden brown and has puffed up nicely. Keep an eye on it in the last few minutes to prevent burning.

Can I use a different type of cheese instead of Brie?

Yes! You can substitute Brie with other soft cheeses like Camembert or goat cheese for a different flavor.

What can I use if I don’t have a mini muffin tin?

If you don’t have a mini muffin tin, you can use a regular muffin tin or even shape the pastry into small freeform cups on a baking sheet.

How do I make an egg wash?

Simply beat one egg with a tablespoon of water or milk. This mixture gives your pastry a beautiful golden color when baked.

How should I store leftovers?

Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 days. Reheat in the oven for a few minutes to recapture the crispiness.

Can I make these bites ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the pastry cups and fill them with cheese and cranberry sauce ahead of time, then bake just before serving.

What’s the best way to serve these bites?

Serve them warm, right out of the oven, as they are best enjoyed fresh. You can garnish with fresh herbs like thyme for added flavor.

Is it safe to eat Brie cheese?

Yes, Brie is safe to eat as long as it is made from pasteurized milk. Always check the label if you have concerns.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free alternative, use gluten-free puff pastry or phyllo dough. To make these bites vegetarian-friendly, ensure the puff pastry does not contain animal-derived ingredients. For a vegan option, substitute the Brie with a plant-based cheese alternative and use a plant-based egg wash (like almond milk mixed with a bit of turmeric for color) or skip the wash altogether.

Pairings

These Cranberry and Brie Bites pair beautifully with a light, crisp white wine such as Sauvignon Blanc or a fruity sparkling wine like Prosecco. For non-alcoholic options, consider serving with sparkling apple cider or a cranberry-infused mocktail. They can also be complemented by a charcuterie board featuring cured meats like prosciutto or salami, and some fresh fruit such as pear slices or grapes to balance the richness of the Brie.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Cranberry and Brie Bites warm for the best flavor experience. Arrange them on a decorative platter, garnished with fresh herbs like rosemary or thyme for an aromatic touch. These bites make an excellent appetizer for holiday gatherings, cocktail parties, or as part of a festive brunch spread. Include small cocktail forks or toothpicks for easy serving and enjoyment. For a touch of elegance, drizzle a little honey over the top before serving.

Cranberry and Brie Bites

$8

Servings: 12

Description

Deliciously warm and gooey Brie cheese paired with sweet cranberry sauce in a flaky pastry shell. Perfect for appetizers or snack time!

Ingredients

  • puff pastry sheets: 1 sheet
  • brie cheese: 8 ounces
  • cranberry sauce: 1/2 cup
  • egg (for egg wash): 1
